title: Engine Won’t Start
question: Why won’t my car start even though the battery is new?
answer: If your battery is working but the engine won't start, check the starter motor, ignition switch, and fuel system. A faulty starter or empty fuel tank could be the culprit.

title: Check Engine Light On
question: What does it mean when my check engine light turns on?
answer: It indicates a diagnostic trouble code was registered. Use an OBD-II scanner to retrieve the code. Common causes include faulty oxygen sensors, loose gas caps, or catalytic converter issues.

title: How to Check Tire Pressure
question: How can I check and maintain proper tire pressure?
answer: Use a tire pressure gauge when tires are cold. Compare readings to your vehicle’s recommended PSI (found on the driver’s door frame). Inflate or deflate accordingly.

title: Brake Pads Worn Out
question: What are the signs of worn-out brake pads?
answer: Squealing noises, longer braking distance, and a vibrating brake pedal are signs. Pads should typically be replaced every 30,000–70,000 miles depending on usage.

title: Oil Change Interval
question: How often should I change my car’s engine oil?
answer: Every 5,000–7,500 miles for synthetic oil, or as recommended in your owner’s manual. More frequent changes may be needed for severe driving conditions.

title: Transmission Slipping
question: My car changes gears erratically. Is my transmission slipping?
answer: Yes, jerky gear shifts or RPM surges could indicate low transmission fluid or internal wear. Have it checked by a mechanic immediately.

title: Battery Drain Overnight
question: Why does my battery drain when the car is off?
answer: Parasitic drain from components like alarms or lights, or a bad alternator diode, could be the reason. Use a multimeter to test current draw when off.

title: AC Not Blowing Cold Air
question: My AC blows warm air. What could be wrong?
answer: Common issues include low refrigerant, faulty compressor, or a clogged cabin filter. A mechanic can do a pressure test to diagnose properly.

title: How to Refill Windshield Washer Fluid
question: Where do I add washer fluid in my car?
answer: Locate the reservoir marked with a windshield icon under the hood. Open the cap and pour the fluid until full. Do not overfill.

title: ABS Light On
question: The ABS light is on. Is it safe to drive?
answer: It’s generally safe, but ABS won’t function in an emergency stop. Causes include dirty wheel sensors or low brake fluid. Get it checked soon.
